alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Wilcox (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dodge and southeastern Wilcox Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Antioch Church, or near Abbeville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Rochelle, Rhine, Browning, Five Points, Antioch Church and Owensboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
